alert.note: Alert for Delaware (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 6:52AM EST until December 19 at 8:12PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...New York... Towanda Creek At Monroeton affecting Bradford County. Tunkhannock Creek At Tunkhannock affecting Wyoming County. West Branch Delaware At Walton affecting Delaware County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Oneida Creek At Oneida affecting Oneida and Madison Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Branch Delaware at Walton. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Fairgrounds begin to flood at 10 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 AM EST Monday was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage to 8.0 feet this morning. It will then rise above flood stage this afternoon to 10.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage again early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
